Time for a history lesson:

Patch 3.14, the entire support class got "reworked" which ended in nearly every support receiving nerfs without suitable compensation.  As a result, this ushered in the dawn of mid-laners being played as supports as they didn't suffer those nerfs because they weren't considered supports at the time.  Of the supports that took the most severe nerfs, were Taric and Sona.  This directly pushed Sona out of the meta and pro players stopped playing her and began playing: **NAMI**  She had more pre-6 CC, stronger mobility, superior sustain, greater damage and a better ult.

For a time, Nami was played as THE go-to sustain support, being specifically picked into Morgana and Janna lanes, while trying to avoid Braum.  This continued until one day, a new face entered the fields of justice: **BARD**  While to this day, people remain constantly skeptical of him, he emerged on the pro season immediately after release, even before his first round of buffs.  With blatantly higher stats, a more versatile and longer-range ult and a stronger kit with potentially infinite scaling, he continues to make his appearance known on the rift in the professional scene.

Nowadays, Soraka has taken the top spot of sustain supports, but she lacks the mobility and low-cooldown **single-target** damage of generalist supports.

For as short-lived as this is though.  As I already mentioned, patch 6.1 is NOT kind to her and brings yet more indirect nerfs.

With the FQC nerfs:

* Her mana problems return.  As one of the hardest mana-gated champs in the game, she could only just get by even with +150 mana gen and she will once again go quickly OoM in prolonged situations.
* Her poor CC yet again becomes a hindrance.  As the only support without reasonable CC outside of her ult, ghosts were the only thing barely keeping her from being instagibbed every other minute.  Even her ult does an unimpressive mediocre job at this and once again she'll be burning its unusually long cooldown on enemies literally already on top of her.

With the Ferocity buffs and Precision nerf:

* Non-supports' damage increase, while her's decreases.  She gets it from both ends with this one, pressuring enemies less whilst she feels the weight even more than before.

---

Who knows though, maybe Meddler will see her these indirect nerfs and raise her some direct ones of his own, as he's already threatened.  If we're lucky, this'll cause a few bleating sheep to take off their blinders and realize what the players of yesteryear already knew.

A few reasons it's off-meta: 

* Only one damage spell with a moderate cooldown. 
* No waveclear, and kinda hard to CS.

===> You will probably be pushed under tower and be under-farmed, you can poke, but you can't really fight, you just hit Q then back, and it's hard to actually get a kill 1v1. And once teams start to group up, if there isn't another source of magic damage in your team, you'll be screwed.

That being said, it's "just" off-meta and not a complete troll pick. In the right team comp, it can be very effective. Think Jana support, Ezreal ADC, Nidalee Jungle, Mundo top, and you have an horrible poke comp, with a lot of sustain and disengage possibilities, and a good mix of damages (maybe a bit too much magic damage, but still a decent amount of AD with Ez and Mundo in melee range).

The thing she has over other mid laners is that she can heal the poke back up that she receives and then bam hit them back. Just watching Brofresco play her against the disgustingly OP Zed on youtube, he's getting poked down a lot but he's also hitting Zed back, and he's trying to freeze the lane buy last hitting the farm. He does get the better hand though and is able to kill him.

I do agree, her csing is awful just like any mage because their AA animations suck and they can't spend too much mana wave clearing with spells like Zed and other energy users who can just farm it up like they are the king of CS.

She can spam her Q to get people to thing twice about going all in on her, and if she's whittled them down a bit, if they try anything, she can just heal and move back to turret, or if she's 6 she can ult and possibly get a kill.

2) Q alone even on full dmg Sona is a joke. The empowered AA that follows, especially if it's Staccato and/or Sheen/Lich is where most of her damage is

What she has over other mid laners is crazy team utility in late game: AoE shield, AoE aa buff, AoE MS buff, strong initiation or counter-engage, single target damage de-buff or slow depending on the situation. The self-heal just makes laning phase tolerable, it lets you survive, but the laning phase is the worst part of Sona mid.

By going full AP mid, her heal is stronger, and it can do wonders in a pinch. One time I was getting ganked and I killed the laner I was against. Their Wu jungler dived me under the turret and I was able to heal, Q, and kill him too.
